title: Hi, I need help. Premades are killing me. The ones on my team I mean.
body:
Can I please get an opt out of premade button?

I am getting sick and tired of these brats who feed and rage at you because they fed. 

I would like to play with randoms and have a fair chance and not have it based off how irritated the chumps are because they got pooped on. Or even worse, they got an ace last game vs the bots so they think they can do it vs people and then cry saying it was all your fault that it didn't work this time and they again got pooped on.

I just want to play the game and have fun again. Premades ruin this shit.

replies.body:
There's no way to *opt-out* of playing with others players who happen to be in a premade. I think in this situation, these player's behavior is less caused by them potentially being in a premade and more of them having a bad game and taking it out on others. The best thing you can do in a situation like this is to mute them in-game if they're bothering you, then report them after the match. In this way, you'll help us prioritize who we look at for negative behavior.

Check out our [Reporting a Player FAQ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884-Reporting-a-Player) for complete details on how this system works. Let me know if you have any other questions.

Can you poke whoever is in charge of the FAQ and ask them to update the part at the end which explains what case correspond to what offense?

Negative attitude doesn't exist anymore, griefing was replaced by something less generic, etc. For instance, what should we do with a player not feeding but using /all chat to give important information to opponents? (No need to answer here, just an example of stuff that should be covered in the FAQ and currently isn't.)

Cheers.

Or like I said before, people who run to your lane and take your farm, even if you are jungle. And they follow you only to contest what you want the entire game. Then they spam emotes and such. Then once you say a SINGLE word, you are reported by all 4 and then the automated BS kicks in and now you can't speak.

I can tell you right now, my main account was bad because of children with no hope to ever get ahead so they simply ruin the game for others. And being that I actually want to get ahead, when I am trolled by these little ass holes with no life, no matter the amount, I get tilted.

Anyone at their job would, especially when they get held back for it.

If I got a win anyway, simply based on my stats as compared to my team, that might encourage me to say, w/e, troll. But the system right now sucks and punishes people who simply want to win.

> Or like I said before, people who run to your lane and take your farm, even if you are jungle. And they follow you only to contest what you want the entire game. Then they spam emotes and such.

^This, is a real problem.

> Then once you say a SINGLE word, you are reported by all 4 and then the automated BS kicks in and now you can't speak.

^ That, is NOT, it's just bullsh*t. I've been through the previous situation you described multiple times, and I never received a single punishment.

The difference between me and you, probably, is that I am a leader who calls things out and am good at the game. 
Generally speaking, kids rage at being wrong and the fact that they can't do what I do or say what I say or see what I see. 

If snapping is looked down upon, AFKing should be allowed because it is BS to be held hostage and forced to deal with shit heads.

Yeah, sure mate, you've been punished because you're good and you're a leader.

Continue lying to yourself, and the only thing you'll get is more punishments.

Would you like to see the game I just played? Because if we had lost and I didn't carry them, I would have been reported, 100%. Even if I didn't do or say anything to anyone. The simple fact is, they hate that I told them not to go. They hate the fact that I was right. I said don't go, they went anyway and paid for it. So they blame me for it because they refuse to admit they were wrong.

But go ahead and continue to speak to me like I am lying. Continue to feed your own ego by denying someone else their claim to fame. Whatever helps you feel like a bigger person, mate.

I'm not saying you're lying, I'm saying that you're delusional, that you're lying TO YOURSELF. The first step toward improvement is admitting your own mistake in order to work on them and to correct them. If you honestly think you're punished because you made a right call and your team didn't like it, you're blind to your own problems. Yes "sanpping" is looked down upon". But "snapping" is not "being a leader", "calling things out" or "being good at the game". And you're punished because you snap, not because of the other 3 things. 

(And ffs, what "fame"? If you're playing LoL to get famous, you've another big problem...)
You can go away, kid. I need to speak to an adult. TY.

Thing is, the adult already answered, like, 17 days ago. So you're stuck with the kids, now -- even though I'm a pretty big, 27 y.o. kid.

So you can insult me and dismiss me all you want, **me** I don't care, I am not the one being punished. I'm trying to help you there. But if you wanna be an ass, feel free.
Oh, I see why you respond still. You need the last word. Have at it.
I keep responding because YOU necro'ed this post after an 11-day period without posts. And once again right now after not responding for 4 days... Would be sad to leave you all alone down there.

You guys must not understand how easy it is to get accounts these days. The only way to help players get ahead is to give them an opt out feature because no punishment will change anything. On top of that, they have vent or some other 3rd party program to speak to one another. And you can't report someone for emote harassment because it is all based on chat. And even if they do say something and get a time out in chat, they don't care. They again have a 3rd party program.

The only way to help people win is to allow them to enjoy full on random games so that no bias exists and people will back you up instead of crying that you are better than they are.
